intro: Trachyandra asperata var. nataglencoensis, commonly known as the Nataglencoensis grass, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, compact foliage. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
